scene_target: Artie accepts a 1 HP / 100% Crit build.
goal: Complete character creation while surviving Fizz's insults.
conflict: Artie's lack of gaming knowledge vs. a glitchy, impatient System guide.
end_condition: Artie confirms the build and is pulled toward the tutorial spawn point.

set.reason: Accidental point-buy allocation during character creation in the System Void.

persona_updates: Artie is now aware he is in a game-like system but lacks the gaming literacy to realize how dangerous a 1 HP build is.

global_continuity_system_updates.reason: Introduction of a 100% Crit Rate anomaly into the system.

inventory_alignment_updates.reason: Normalization of inventory posture upon entering the void.

chapter_so_far_add: Artie met his guide Fizz and accidentally created a broken 1 HP / 100% Crit build.
key_events: Artie encounters Fizz, a snarky System Guide, in the server-room-scented void.
The System presents a Point Buy UI with 10 available stat points.
Artie mistakes 'Critical Hit Rate' for a performance metric and dumps all points into it.
The System confirms the build, locking Artie at 1/1 HP and 100% Crit Rate.
Artie earns the title 'Statistical Anomaly' and the 'Glass Cannon' build designation.
The Tutorial Quest 'Survive the Spawn' is initiated as the void dissolves.
Artie is dropped from the void into a lush forest tutorial zone.
last_scene: Artie met his System Guide, Fizz, in the Character Creation Void following his death.
Due to a physical spasm and a misunderstanding of gaming terminology, he accidentally allocated all his starting stat points into Critical Hit Rate.
This resulted in a 'Glass Cannon' build with only 1 HP but a 100% chance to land critical hits.
must_stay_true: inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Corporate ID Badge (status=equipped, container=neck)
injury: vending machine scar on right knuckle
